full_text: Happy 46th wedding anniversary to my wife, Toni. You are an incredible teacher, mother, and friend, and I am humbled to have you as my partner. https://t.co/WYrbia9K4X

We also visited the Vigor Shipyard, where we checked out the construction of our first Alaska Class ferry, the M/V Tazlina. The Tazlina will be 280 feet long & carry up to 300 passengers, and will begin service in 2019. We're excited for this next step of connecting Alaskans. https://t.co/dCwG3uMpFx

.@AkGovBillWalker and I had a great time in Ketchikan yesterday. The highlight was stopping by Ketchikan HS to celebrate the @OfficialKayhi Academic Decathlon team's national win! They are the first winning team from AK. Thanks to all those who came out to support the team. https://t.co/wvJcIFAruG

I met AK State Trooper Anthony April this weekend at the Anchorage Family Affair Youth Summit. This event provides youth with educational, health, and other resources, and also allows community members to get to know those who are working for a #SaferAlaska. Thank you, Anthony! https://t.co/ez7iBBy4rx

On Tuesday, I spent the day on Prince of Wales visiting Hollis School, where students are creating natural recipes to combat the harmful effects of pesticides in their 'Rainforest at Risk" project. Thank you Ms. Cates and Hollis students for a great visit! https://t.co/z9Kz8g8TIQ

Today @AkGovBillWalker  and I met with students from Eek, Noorvik, and Buckland, who are visiting Juneau as part of their Alaska Humanities Forum Sister Schools visit. Thank you to @akhumanities for this incredible program that brings together young Alaskans from across the state https://t.co/jAgJc4IuQh

I had an excellent time meeting our @USArcticYouth Ambassadors at the #ArcticEncounter Symposium today. These 13 young Alaskans are sharing their stories to raise awareness about our changing Arctic, and are yet another example of emerging leaders paving the way for change. https://t.co/a9PAEtNzb8

Happy birthday to @akgovbillwalker! Your tireless leadership and your dedication to our great state reminds me what Alaskans can accomplish when we put our minds to it. Wishing you a joyous birthday surrounded by family, friends, and banana cream pie. https://t.co/bM0oSyy7Fs

[3/3] Thank you to all of the team members, to @AkGovBillWalker for creating this team and for participating in the meeting, and to @CNCnorth and all of our staff for making this incredible event happen. We are looking forward to future listening sessions around the state.

but also prepare us to take advantage of the opportunities created by diversifying our economy. In our public listening session on Wednesday, the team heard a call for bold action on climate change. We have heard you, and we are thinking boldly. https://t.co/LeURauuUnP

[1/3] Just got back from @uafairbanks and the second in-person meeting of our Climate Action Leadership Team. I am in awe of the enthusiasm and vision of this group of leaders, who are all committed to developing climate solutions that not only protect Alaska's resiliency, https://t.co/tQcjLnO0SV

Eager to contribute to the fight against opioids, @AkGovBillWalker and I personally donated to the purchase of a K9 drug-sniffing dog for Yakutat & Cordova. Last week, I got to meet Bo and his handler, Yakutat Police Officer Paul Pajak. Thank you Bo and Paul for your hard work! https://t.co/MEnUEc4050
Thank you to the members of AK @MomsDemand for visiting the Capitol yesterday. We always appreciate the enthusiasm and engagement of dedicated Alaskans. https://t.co/hQhrk8xPPQ

quoted_status.full_text: Thank you @AkGovBillWalker and @LtGovMallott for meeting with AK @MomsDemand to talk about common sense solutions to gun violence! https://t.co/BZrlUFm6xG

full_text: "[T]here is no thing so powerful as an idea whose time has come…there is no person so right as one who struggles for the rights of others." Happy 90th birthday to the legendary Maya Angelou, whose works as a poet, writer, singer, and activist continue to inspire and educate. https://t.co/ZJrDiTI6YW
Great thread w/ Senior Advisor on Climate Policy Dr. Nikoosh Carlo sharing our #climatechange priorities on Talk of Alaska this morning. https://t.co/1ArhTkLFYm

quoted_status.full_text: “Alaska is Ground Zero for climate change. Many communities across the state are seeing the impacts of change: Kivalina, Newtok, Shishmaref, and more. We have 31 coastal villages that are classified as threatened.” - Nikoosh Carlo

full_text: In case you missed it: Senior Climate Advisor @CNCnorth and Chris Rose of @REalaska joined @waldholz on Talk of Alaska this morning to discuss our climate leadership team and our work towards Alaskan-focused solutions to #climatechange. @alaskapublic https://t.co/aVGoBihFzT

Last week at #ComFish2018 in Kodiak, I had the chance to meet mariculture innovators, fishermen, & marine conservationists and speak about tackling climate change with Alaskan solutions. I also stopped by the Exhibit Hall to try some of @tridentseafoods samples! @KodiakChamber https://t.co/KFcaq0evHI
An Alaska tradition: the Camai Festival in Bethel last weekend. A big thank you to the performers, whose energy and joy radiated through the audience. https://t.co/YmgoHlh9cD

Last week I spoke at the Native Issues Forum hosted by @ccthita and discussed the need to improve emergency response in our rural areas. @AkGovBillWalker and I consider Alaskans' safety to be our foremost responsibility, and will continue to work on our Public Safety Action Plan. https://t.co/8WWU0xP0nc

Shout out to @AlaskaAir for providing charter service to all @AWGTeamAlaska members participating in the 2018 Arctic Winter Games. #TeamAlaska was proud to participate in a once-in-a-lifetime experience and so was I. Thanks for getting us there Alaska style! #iflyAlaska https://t.co/TldYJSzdtC
Kudos to the Alaska Division of Elections for the first Native Language Summit that just got underway in Anchorage. Watch their Facebook live feed here: https://t.co/SK1azQxOEU

I'm honored to accompany #TeamAlaska to the Northwest Territories for the Arctic Winter Games 2018. With over 2,000 attendees from 9 Arctic regions, this is an exciting event that brings together diverse northern communities while supporting our athletes. #awg2018 @AWGTeamAlaska https://t.co/IaXQtFVnfl

"To underestimate the risks or rate of climate change is to gamble with our children’s futures, and that is not a bet that we are willing to make.” Thanks to @akgovbillwalker and our climate leadership team for their commitment to addressing #climatechange
https://t.co/F51V6gzsXX

.@akgovbillwalker and I were honored to address Tribal leaders at #TCCAnnualConvention2018 this week. We feel privileged to hear from @TananaChiefs members, and we will continue to strive for the empowerment and self-determination of Native communities. #TCC2018 https://t.co/EQbjQmltIH

Congratulations to the new District 38 Representative, Tiffany Zulkosky! We greatly appreciate all of your past work for rural communities (including your service as the youngest mayor of Bethel!) and look forward to your future accomplishments in the #akleg. https://t.co/kuC6cT8rwM

At the Mendenhall Glacier today filming a short welcome for the future winners of @planet_forward #Storyfest2018, who will have a once-in-a-lifetime cruise through SE Alaska. Good luck to all of the entrants, whose passion for storytelling will take them to many great places. https://t.co/EoaYvS0GX3
Toni and I wish Representative @DavidGuttenberg a quick recovery.

Stopped by @KTOOpubmedia studios today to participate in the Talk of Alaska radio show. Thank you for the opportunity to discuss our ideas for the future of the Permanent Fund, as well as our commitment to preserve the PFD for current and future generations of Alaskans. @aprn https://t.co/a7uhUKNFPz

I had a great time last night at the @UFA_Fish & AFDF Symphony of Seafoods in #Juneau. Congratulations to all of the winners, including Alaskan Leader Seafoods and Barnacle Foods. Thank you for all you do to promote our wild and sustainable Alaskan seafood! https://t.co/4mMrtK29jw

@DHSgov disputes @NBCNews story on #cybersecurity that included #Alaska. Last year we shared with Alaskans that Russians attempted to scan election systems in 21 states. A bad guy trying to peek in shuttered window does not = a burglary. We remain concerned, vigilant & proactive.

I'm lucky to share in many lighthearted moments with local communities, like when @akgovbillwalker and I were swept off our feet at the Tlingit & Haida Elders Program Valentine's Day dance this year. Thank you to our gracious dance partners! https://t.co/1BIZkw6BZw

It was an honor to celebrate the life of Ahtna elder Roy Ewan this past weekend in Glenallen. Roy was a former co-chair of @NativeFed and President of @AhtnaInc, as well as a tireless leader and a fierce advocate for the subsistence rights of Alaska Natives. https://t.co/rVfepBAEKg

At a @seagrant meeting in Juneau, I had the honor of meeting Noah Idechong, a champion of marine conservation. A former member of the Palau House of Delegates & Time Magazine “Hero for the Planet”, he continues to advocate for responsible resource management. Thanks @UOGseaGrant! https://t.co/DJiyiC8FGh

Today we celebrate #ElizabethPeratrovich Day to honor “her courageous, unceasing efforts to eliminate discrimination and bring about equal rights in Alaska”, reminding us to continue to advocate for equality and justice in our communities. https://t.co/T0JONoH3QR https://t.co/VOB1cB8d6R
Happy Valentine’s Day to my wife of nearly 46 years, Toni. I’m a very lucky man to have you by my side. #ValentinesDay https://t.co/pv4kOc73S8

This morning, I spoke to Southeast Conference members about transboundary issues, the Alaska Marine Highway, and regional economic development. I’m pleased to share in their work to promote strong economies, healthy communities, and a quality environment in Southeast Alaska. https://t.co/nNzoMUmIVt

. @AkGovBillWalker and I had the privilege of speaking at the AFN Quarterly Meeting today in Juneau. It is critical that we continue to listen to and elevate Native voices in our efforts to create a safer, stronger, and smarter Alaska.  @NativeFed https://t.co/CO0gGliKOR

It was a pleasure to speak at the Alaska Forum on the Environment this morning. This exciting four-day event brings together state and national leaders and innovators to tackle Alaska’s environmental issues and challenges. @alaskaforum #akforum2018

Today, @AkGovBillWalker and I met with delegates from the China People’s Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries to discuss future opportunities for cooperation between Alaska and China. We look forward to continuing to grow our diplomatic relations with China. https://t.co/82U0gevjci

@Akgovbillwalker and I had a great time at the #akgovawards in Juneau last night. Thank you to @akhumanities,
@arts4Alaska, the Alaska Arts and Culture Foundation, and all of the award recipients for their artistic contributions and community leadership. https://t.co/Ub1OgC739P
Looking for Amazing Alaskans to be part of #Climate Action for Alaska Leadership Team - Alaska Online Public Notices https://t.co/CfuaMNYXm4
#Alaska dealing with #climatechange by pulling together. https://t.co/YAWul1dFhj

In Deadhorse for opening of #ASRC fabrication shop. #Quintillion Fiber Optic System = faster connections and reduced rates to rural AK.
